channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12413] Mismatch in the equals and hashcode methods of KeyValue
item.description: In the equals method of KeyValue only row key is compared, and in the hashcode method all bacing bytes are calculated. This breaks the Java rule.
item.summary: Mismatch in the equals and hashcode methods of KeyValue

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Upload the patch to only calculate the row key in the hashcode method of KeyValue.
equals consider other elements other than rk. We need to include them also. Why not including (such as cf,q etc)?
Thanks Anoop Sam John, I forgot to include the cf, q, ts and type in the hashcode calculation. Will add it in the next patch. Thanks.
Update the patch according to Anoop's comments.
Hi Anoop Sam John, do you want to have a look at this patch? Thanks.
Looks good to me. +1.

This message is automatically generated.

lgtm
This is an incompatible change, right ?

Ted Yu if this change is incompatible (i.e. if it breaks anything), I would assume that it is just making it more clear that that thing was broken anyhow. The case I'm imagining is that KeyValues are being put into a HashSet or used as keys in a HashMap – in this case, the current (unpatched) behavior would be non-determinsitic, but may appear to "work" in many cases (i.e. the fact that the client code is broken might not be immediately visible).

I think that committing this can only be a good thing – I think that the worst case is that it would make it more clear that already-broken code is actually broken.

Alright.

Can we get a clean QA run ?

Here's a slightly altered patch that removes the need to change the visibility of CellComparator.calculateHashForKeyValue, and adds some basic testing of the equals and hashCode methods on KeyValue. I'll try to get a new QA run on this and hopefully it'll be clean.

lgtm


1068	   * In line with {@link #equals(Object)}, only compares the key portion,

1069	   * not the value.

Looks like the verb 'compares' is not accurate: we're calculating hash code, right ?

Thanks Gabriel Reid.
In the patch V3, it tries to calculate the hashCode with mvcc whereas in equal it doesn't.
Should we use hashCodeIgnoreMvcc instead of hashCode of CellComparator when calculating KeyValue hashcode?
Sorry Ted Yu, I did miss your reply, sorry for that!

Thanks for taking a look Ted Yu and Jingcheng Du. Here's an updated patch that fixes the javadoc verb issue (compares replaced by uses), and also ignores MVCC when calculating the hash code (including a test to verify this).
Thanks Gabriel Reid. lgtm.

Why was this only committed to trunk? After code inspection this appears relevant for 0.98. (Patch attached.) Therefore, almost surely all active branches.

I'm currently running the test suite after changing this in 0.98.
Enis Soztutar Nick Dimiduk
+1 on all branches because of Gabriel Reid reasoning above.
Ok, I'm on it stack, thanks for taking a look. Will do so when the 0.98 suite comes back (paranoia)
is 0.94 impacted?
Pushed everywhere 0.98+. Ran TestKeyValue on all of them first. A bunch of units from 0.98 came back ok already and anyway I can't argue with that logic either.

is 0.94 impacted?

Doesn't look like it
